title: Sr. Inside Sales Representative
description:
At Polaris Inc., we have fun doing what we love by driving change and innovation. We empower employees to take on challenging assignments and roles with an elevated level of responsibility in our agile working environment. Our people make us who we are, and we create incredible products and experiences that empower us to THINK OUTSIDE.

Job Summary

The Sr. Inside Sales Representative will be an important part of the Polaris Government and Defense team. They will be the face of our business to government customers and partners around the country and will be responsible for interacting with them and representing Polaris. It will be important to be outgoing, a great communicator, and willing to spend time assisting customers on the phone or over email with questions regarding their vehicle choices. Vehicle knowledge will be an integral part of this job, including vehicle specs and customization. This role will be comprised largely of providing quotes to government customers as well as partners and assisting them with placing orders.

Duties And Responsibilities

Manage the Polaris Gov & Defense sales funnel as primary point of contact for customer facing government sales effortsResponsible for the Government and Defense hotline and email inbox, meeting daily completion targets for quoting and response timesCreate, support, or submit formal bids for federal, state and local opportunities through the quoting processConducts sales calls to identify needs with current and prospective customers and make/quote product and accessory recommendationsAssist in management of Defense Logistics Agency (DLA), government direct, third party, Sourcewell and State Contract customer relationships and pursuitsAssist in maintaining CRM quote generation program to include control of price list information and compliance with terms of each contract price list, in addition to daily capture and management/maintenance of customer information databaseWork with inside sales team, SIOP, and operations to ensure vehicle, parts, and accessories (PG&A) availabilityGeneral support - assist Polaris staff/consultants with projects, customer follow-up, shipping, tracking and issue resolutionLiaison between customers and Service Support to ensure delivery, technical service, training, and/or post-sales supportShow and demo support as needed - assist with show preparation, set-up, and work the booth

Minimum Requirements

Two year AA/AS or bachelor’s degree in any field preferredMinimum three years’ sales experience preferred with experience in business-to-business sales and/or business to consumer sales. Experience with Government/Military business preferred, specifically as it relates to the government contracting processStrong numeric skills, with the ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, and percentages. Basic knowledge and application of statistics and strong Excel skills.Proficiency with computer programs: Word, Powerpoint, ExcelProficiency with Polaris programs: CRM and AS400 preferredStrong communication skills required - verbal (including phone), written and listening Extensive product knowledge (department expert) preferredStrong problem solving skillsExcellent time-management and prioritization skillsSelf-motivated team playerHigh level of integrityGreat attention to detail

WORKING CONDITIONS

Dynamic environment with competing priorities in a standard office environmentLess than 10% travel

We are an ambitious, resourceful, and driven workforce, which empowers us to THINK OUTSIDE. Apply today!

At Polaris we put our employees first, by offering a holistic approach to their health and financial wellbeing. Polaris is proud to offer competitive compensation, including a market-leading profit-sharing plan that is fundamental to our pay-for-performance culture. At Polaris, employees are owners of the company through company contributions to our Employee Stock Ownership Plan and discounted employee stock purchases plan. Employees receive a generous matching contribution to 401(k), financial wellness education and consultation to plan for their financial future. In addition to competitive pay, Polaris provides a comprehensive suite of benefits, including health, dental, and vision insurance, wellness programs, paid time off, gym & personal training reimbursement, life insurance and disability offerings. Through the Polaris Foundation and our Polaris Gives paid volunteer time off, we support employees who actively volunteer their time, efforts, and passions to improve the health and wellbeing of the communities in which they live, play and work. Employees at Polaris drive our success and are rewarded for their commitment.

About Polaris

As the global leader in powersports, Polaris Inc. (NYSE: PII) pioneers product breakthroughs and enriching experiences and services that have invited people to discover the joy of being outdoors since our founding in 1954. Polaris' high-quality product line-up includes the Polaris RANGER®, RZR® and Polaris GENERAL™ side-by-side off-road vehicles; Sportsman® all-terrain off-road vehicles; military and commercial off-road vehicles; snowmobiles; Indian Motorcycle® mid-size and heavyweight motorcycles; Slingshot® moto-roadsters; Aixam quadricycles; Goupil electric vehicles; and pontoon and deck boats, including industry-leading Bennington pontoons. Polaris enhances the riding experience with a robust portfolio of parts, garments, and accessories. Proudly headquartered in Minnesota, Polaris serves more than 100 countries across the globe. www.polaris.com

EEO Statement

Polaris is an Equal Opportunity Employer and will make all employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, familial status, status with regard to public assistance, membership or activity in a local commission, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

title: Project Engineer
description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Jobot, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

We have developed a first of it's kind technology changing the most complex industrial challenges in agriculture, horticulture, aquaculture, wastewater, and more!

This Jobot Job is hosted by: Jessica Porter

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.

Salary: $100,000 - $125,000 per year

A bit about us:

We are a U.S.-based engineering firm dedicated to unleashing the full potential of our patent technology to enhance and safeguard water, food, and natural resources. Our specialized systems can effectively replace inefficient, energy-consuming gas transfer equipment and harmful chemical oxidants and surfactants. This revolutionary technology offers a singular, energy-efficient, and chemical-free solution.

With over 600 products deployed at customer sites across 30+ countries on six continents, the company has proven its global impact. Boasting 13 patents and patent applications, we aim to expand its patent portfolio, covering the diverse applications in physical, chemical, and biological processes. Recognized with accolades such as the Fast Company World Changing Ideas and AgTech Breakthrough awards, we have also been featured in Forbes.

Why join us?

Join our team where we live and breathe our core values:

 Collaboration and Clear Communication:

Prioritizing clear, honest communication, we function as a cohesive team, driving collective success.

We acknowledge and appreciate the value of every team member's time, ideas, results, and safety.

 Creative Problem-Solving:

We tackle complex problems with creativity, taking calculated risks and learning from our mistakes.

Our commitment is to continuously apply these lessons, fostering an environment where innovation thrives.

 Ownership and Accountability:

We believe in taking ownership of our work, ensuring we deliver on commitments.

When mistakes happen, we own up to them, fostering a culture that strives for excellence in providing the best products and services.

If you're looking for a workplace that values collaboration, creativity, and accountability, where your contributions are genuinely appreciated, come join us on our journey towards achieving our vision.

Job Details

Job Details:

We are seeking a dynamic and skilled Permanent Project Engineer to join our innovative engineering team. This role offers the opportunity to participate in ground-breaking projects, working with a team of accomplished engineers. The successful candidate will be a key contributor to the design and development of various engineering projects, utilizing their expertise in 2D and 3D modeling, SolidWorks, CAD, and other engineering software. They will also be involved in assembly drawing creation, BOM generation, and stakeholder management. The candidate should possess a strong understanding of hydraulic or pneumatic systems. This role requires a minimum of 3 years of experience in a similar capacity.

Responsibilities:

 Develop, design, and test engineering projects using 2D and 3D modeling techniques. Utilize SolidWorks and CAD software for project design and development. Create and manage assembly drawings, ensuring all designs are accurate and meet project specifications. Generate and manage Bills of Materials (BOM). Collaborate with project stakeholders, providing regular updates and ensuring all project requirements are met. Apply knowledge of hydraulic or pneumatic systems to design and testing processes. Coordinate with other engineering teams to ensure project objectives and timelines are met. Participate in project meetings and provide expert advice and feedback on project design and development. Resolve project issues in a timely and efficient manner, ensuring minimal impact on project progress. Continually update knowledge and skills in line with industry developments.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field. Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Project Engineer in the Engineering industry. Proficiency in 2D and 3D modeling, SolidWorks, CAD, GD&T, and other relevant engineering software. Experience in assembly drawing creation and BOM generation. Excellent stakeholder management skills, with the ability to communicate effectively with all project stakeholders. Strong knowledge of hydraulic or pneumatic systems. Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to resolve project issues swiftly and efficiently. Strong organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Excellent attention to detail, ensuring all project designs are accurate and meet project specifications. Continual learner, willing to update knowledge and skills in line with industry developments.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

description:

Job Details

Job Details:

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our esteemed technology team. This is a full-time, permanent position that offers a unique opportunity to play a critical role in maintaining and optimizing our HPC (High-Performance Computing) infrastructure. The successful candidate will be responsible for the development and implementation of software solutions, automation of configuration processes, and the overall enhancement of our system's operational efficiency.

Responsibilities:

 Develop, maintain, and enhance our Linux-based HPC clusters and data centers. Design and implement robust, scalable, and high-availability server architectures. Implement and manage continuous delivery systems and methodologies. Develop and maintain configuration management solutions using Ansible. Use various scripting languages such as Python and Shell to automate tasks and enhance system performance. Collaborate with the development team to improve system efficiency, enhance the automation process, and ensure the scalability and stability of the system. Create clear and concise documentation related to the HPC infrastructure and the solutions implemented. Troubleshoot any issues related to the HPC infrastructure and provide timely resolutions. Participate in on-call rotations and be available to handle critical system incidents.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical discipline. A minimum of 5 years' experience in a DevOps Engineer role or similar capacity. Solid experience with Linux, DevOps, clustering, scripting, Python, Shell Scripting, Ansible configuration, HPC Cluster, and HPC Data Center. Strong understanding of code and script (Python, Perl, and/or Ruby). Familiarity with open-source technologies and cloud services. Proven experience in designing and implementing high-availability server architectures. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure to meet tight deadlines. Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with a diverse team of IT professionals. Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

In conclusion, if you are a tech-savvy professional who is passionate about developing innovative solutions and enhancing system performance, we would love to hear from you. This is an excellent opportunity to grow your career and make a significant impact in a fast-paced, technology-driven company.

Why join us?

Be one of us at the best global professional service firms in the world!

Job Details

Job Details:

As a Senior Test Engineer - Gaming, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of the technology and gaming industry. You will be part of a dynamic team responsible for testing and validating cutting-edge gaming technology and software. This role is perfect for someone who has a deep understanding of mathematics, gaming, and software testing, as well as proficiency in a variety of programming languages. As a senior member of the team, you will also provide leadership and guidance, ensuring the highest standards of testing are met.

Responsibilities:

 Develop and execute test plans to ensure that all objectives are met. Implement and monitor test scripts to assess functionality, reliability, performance, and quality of the service or product. Identify and remedy defects within the production process. Collaborate with other engineers and product development teams during product design phase to understand product scope and then create appropriate test process and strategy. Provide leadership and guidance to junior team members, fostering an environment of continuous learning and improvement. Ensure all gaming software and systems comply with applicable regulations and standards. Collaborate with mathematicians to understand the mathematical models used in our games and validate their implementation in code. Utilize statistical tools to interpret data sets, paying particular attention to trends and patterns that could be valuable for diagnostic and predictive analytics efforts.

Qualifications:

 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Game Development, or a related field. Minimum of 3 years of experience in a Test Engineer role or similar. Proficiency in C++, C#, C/C++, and Java programming languages. Experience with Windows, Unix, and Linux operating systems. Strong knowledge of mathematical testing and statistics. Experience in the gaming industry, including a deep understanding of gaming regulations. Strong leadership skills with a dedication to driving and achieving results. Excellent problem-solving and communication skills. Strong attention to detail, with a logical and methodical approach to testing. Experience working with mathematicians and understanding complex mathematical models. Knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes. Experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases. Passion for gaming and technology.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Senior Test Engineer - Slots

title: Purchasing Coordinator
description:
Purchasing Coordinator
 Defibtech is a leading innovator in the field of automated external defibrillators (AEDs) and other lifesaving resuscitation products. We are on a mission to increase survival from sudden cardiac arrest and transform the pre-hospital treatment of sudden cardiac arrest patients. 
With more than 550,000 defibrillators deployed worldwide in various language configurations, Defibtech has drawn accolades and won numerous awards for innovative product design, growth, quality, and services. Based along the shoreline of Connecticut, we design and manufacture our products in the United States. 
As a growing medical device company, we strive to foster the valuable cultural aspects of our start-up roots with enthusiasm to roll up our sleeves and do what it takes to get things done. We are searching for team members that exemplify our values of passion, innovation, integrity, and ownership across every aspect of their work.
Defibtech is seeking a Purchasing Coordinator responsible for supporting the planning and purchasing of materials. This position is based onsite at our manufacturing site in Branford, CT. 
 Core Responsibilities: 
Executes purchases based on company policy, including compliance with Quality standards, Levels of Approval and Purchase Order Processing instructions.Purchases assigned materials per defined triggers or authorized requests.Periodically expedites deliveries and updates Purchase Orders accordingly.Collaborates with members of Supply Chain, Inventory Management, and Production to support and plan material procurement strategies.Manages material returns to suppliers.Manages Kan Ban stock programs with inventory personnel for replenishment. Works with Accounting and Finance teams to troubleshoot invoicing issues.Participates in supplier evaluations and periodic reviews as required.Maintains open purchase orders, including line-item accuracy. Collaborate with production and vendors to verify delivery dates and adjust purchase orders with vendors accordingly.Demonstrates Defibtech’s values on the job and promotes and participates in continuous improvement.Actively supports compliance of Company operations to all applicable laws, regulations and standards, good business practices and company documented procedures (including but not limited to FDA, Quality Systems Regulations, safety regulations and applicable statutes).

Qualifications / Requirements:
Associate degree or equivalent work experience required.At least 2 years of previous experience with supporting business operations.Understanding of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems - Epicor or SAP preferred.Understanding of the different classes of inventory (raw materials, WIP, finished goods, MRO, service parts, damaged and obsolete). Strong interpersonal communication skills in writing, over the phone, and in-person.Ability to work cross functionally and with external suppliers.Ability to always work with all internal and external contacts in a positive and courteous mannerAbility to multi-task and work in a fast paced, high-volume environment.

Work Environment and Physical Demands:
Work environment is primarily office based, with occasional warehouse tasks.Light work that includes moving objects up to 20 lbs.; frequent walking/standing.

Compensation and Benefits:  
Defibtech offers competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits package including core health benefits, company-paid disability, and a company matching 401k plan. Defibtech promotes a challenging, collaborative, and friendly culture that is centered around our values: Passion, Innovation, Integrity, and Ownership. Defibtech is supportive of work balance providing company gatherings to add fun and generous paid time off and flexibility for employees to manage time and responsibilities.Defibtech is committed to empowering and supporting our employees in their philanthropic efforts through donation programs and time off for volunteerism. 

Defibtech is committed to a diverse workplace and is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and E-Verify Company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.  
The above description of core responsibilities and qualifications are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position. title: Sr. Org. Development Consultant
description:
Career Area

Product Support

Job Description

 Your Work Shapes the World at Caterpillar Inc. 

When you join Caterpillar, you're joining a global team who cares not just about the work we do – but also about each other. We are the makers, problem solvers, and future world builders who are creating stronger, more sustainable communities. We don't just talk about progress and innovation here – we make it happen, with our customers, where we work and live. Together, we are building a better world, so we can all enjoy living in it.

 J   OB PURPOSE:  Working in conjunction with a Supervisor and/or Global Dealer Learning (GDL) team, this role will provide direction and execution regarding building dealer Sales Performance and Leadership (for Sales & Service ) capabilities thru learning solutions. The role will enable active communication for increased district and dealer awareness and participation in successful programs and evaluate new opportunities.

Development consultant activities include project leadership of cross-functional team focused on global solutions related to design and deployment of learning, change management, learning impact and engagement, learning technology, competency design, and learning recognition.

This role will also support promotion of Sales and Leadership offering, provide project leadership for vendor learning development, manage vendors agreements and invoicing, and provide administration support for vendor partner programs. This included management and expansion of existing learning programs such as Flagship and Rutgers MCP.

Additional responsibilities may include the ability to deliver instructor-led training and support the development of internal and external training instructors.

Job Duties

 Collaborate with process owners, GDL workforce development consultants, and external vendors to develop and implement dealer Sales Performance and Leadership (for Sales & Service) learning solutions.  Participate in research or benchmarking of internal and external best practices related to organizational learning, with emphasis on Sales Performance and Leadership learning solutions.  Achieve project goals by leading or participating on projects as a team member or learning design and deployment subject matter expert.  Requires ability to pull together observations, ideas and issues into clear presentations and strategies.  Utilize, monitor and continuously improve products, services and processes used for working with our customers.  Influence decision makers with the support of supervisor and peers to maximize learning effectiveness to achieve business results.  Assist with on-boarding new team members with support of supervisor or peers.  Develop, implement, and conduct learning programs to maximize sales performance and leadership effectiveness. Measure and maximize training effectiveness and communicate the impact to internal and external stakeholders.  Research and analyze new learning methods to determine feasibility of use and application in future programs.  Ensure training programs reflect both the current product / industry mix and business strategy.  Provide consultancy to customers and stakeholders about capability building aligned to sales and service goals. 

Skills

 Customer Focus:  Knowledge of the values and practices that align customer needs and satisfaction as primary considerations in all business decisions and ability to leverage that information in creating customized customer solutions.

 Service Excellence:  Knowledge of customer service concepts and techniques; ability to meet or exceed customer needs and expectations and provide excellent service in a direct or indirect manner.

 Consulting:  Knowledge of techniques, roles, and responsibilities in providing technical or business guidance to clients, both internal and external; ability to apply consulting knowledge appropriately.

 Decision Making and Critical Thinking:  Knowledge of the decision-making process and associated tools and techniques; ability to accurately analyze situations and reach productive decisions based on informed judgment.

 Effective Communications:  Understanding of effective communication concepts, tools and techniques; ability to effectively transmit, receive, and accurately interpret ideas, information, and needs through the application of appropriate communication behaviors.

 Problem Solving:  Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems; ability to apply knowledge of problem solving appropriately to diverse situations.

 Relationship Management:  Knowledge of relationship management techniques; ability to establish and maintain healthy working relationships with clients, vendors, and peers.

 Training Operations:  Knowledge of training processes and procedures; ability to implement training related tasks and programs to ensure smooth daily and strategic training operations.

Background/Experience

 A four-year degree and Masters (or MBA) in a related HR or Learning-related field is desired or four or more years of progressive experience in Learning and Instruction  Excellent planning and organizational skills,  Highly accountable  Strong interpersonal skills  Analytical and problem-solving ability  Exceptional customer focus, team player, and persuasive communication/presentation and change management skills.

title: Marketing Analytics Specialist
description:
This position is responsible for collaborating with various channels within Marketing along with the Marketing Analytics team to report on the performance of advertising placements relating to print and digital ads. The Marketing Analytics Specialist will need to analyze trends in advertising performance metrics to identify which ad placements are working well and why, as well as what can be improved upon. The Marketing Analytics Specialist will work closely with leadership and management to understand what is needed and provide consistent updates on the progress of work being completed.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Partner with Marketing Analytics team and leadership to create easy-to-understand dashboards, tracking spreadsheets, and presentations that bring forward data-driven insights and revenue attribution reports.Tracking campaign and channel level performance by cohesively analyzing data from various internal and external databases.Identify trends and marketing insights from data and communicate with project shareholders in a clear and concise manner.Create the department’s monthly Google Analytics performance report on all digital advertising.Manage dashboards to be presented to key and strategic supplier partners on a monthly and quarterly basis. Utilize the feedback provided to make edits and adjustments to dashboards as requested.Analyze trends in advertising performance metrics to identify which ad placements in each supplier’s marketing plan are working best, why, and tactics that can be improved upon. Recommendations will be needed on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis for all advertising vehicles.Creates adhoc reports, monthly reporting and works on special projects on an as needed basis.Identify the optimal audience for different digital marketing initiatives by analyzing customer intelligence.
SPECIFIC KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:Preferred work experience in data-driven marketing strategy and planning.Highly skilled in Marketo and Salesforce.High proficiency in PowerBI and Excel is requiredGoogle Analytics Certification is requiredStrong organizational and analytical skillsStrong marketing acumen, experience in e-commerce or medical supplies is highly preferredHighly effective communicator
GENERAL SKILLS & COMPETENCIES: Basic understanding of industry practicesGeneral proficiency with tools, systems, and proceduresBasic planning/organizational skills and techniquesGood decision making, analysis and problem solving skillsGood verbal and written communication skillsBasic presentation and public speaking skillsBasic interpersonal skillsDeveloping professional credibility
MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE: Typically 2 to 4 years of related professional experience.
PREFERRED EDUCATION: Typically a Bachelor's Degree or global equivalent in related discipline.
TRAVEL / PHYSICAL DEMANDS:Travel typically less than 10%. Office environment. No special physical demands required.
The posted range for this position is $45,000-$95,445 which is the expected starting base salary range for an employee who is new to the role to fully proficient in the role. Many factors go into determining employee pay within the posted range including prior experience, current skills, location/labor market, internal equity, etc.This position is eligible for a bonus not reflected in the posted range.Other benefits available include: Medical, Dental and Vision Coverage, 401K Plan with Company Match, Time off, Paid Parental Leave, Income Protection, Work Life Assistance Program, Flexible Spending Accounts, Educational Benefits, Worldwide Scholarship Program and Volunteer Opportunities.

title: Government Sales Specialist - Military
company_name: Vehicle Service Group, A Dover Company
description:
Part of Dover Corporation’s Engineered Systems segment, Vehicle Service Group (VSG) is a strong, diverse and dynamic global leader in the vehicle service industry. VSG comprises 13 major vehicle lifting, wheel service, diagnostic and collision repair brands: Rotary Lift®, Chief®, Forward®, Direct-Lift®, Ravaglioli, Hanmecson®, Revolution®, Elektron, Blitz, Nogra, Butler, Space and Sirio.

SUMMARY:

Responsible for all Government Military Sales, actions and results for the US Military. Consistently increase Military Sales, by ensuring we are engaged with every procurement avenue available.

COMPANY OVERVIEW: Dover’s Vehicle Service Group is the global leader in designing and manufacturing vehicle service, collision and automotive OEM equipment. It is one of the founding companies of Dover Corporation, an eight billion dollar diversified global manufacturer. VSG consists of fifteen leading vehicle lifting brands (Rotary, Forward, Blitz, Ravaglioli etc.), collision repair (Chief), wheel services, diagnostics (Butler, Rotary, Chief and Ravaglioli) and tier-one automotive brands (Warn Automotive) with operations worldwide, including regional business operation centers and large manufacturing facilities in the U.S., Europe and Asia.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS INCLUDE:

Frequent overnight travel (by vehicle or by air) away from home.Have phone, written and personnel sales contact with all forms of Military contacts. Make end-Users calls to support sales efforts of all Military branches.Establish relationships with active Military procurement officers.Establish relationships with all current forms of sub-contractors for equipment sales to the Military.Understand business climates in the Military by analyzing business trends and by thorough communication with all types of customers.Understand competitors in a given region or territory and utilize that information to have business plans to combat competition or seek them as customers.Help establish sales goals and projections for Military salesPrepare and utilize a business contact agenda on all contacts.Have a thorough knowledge and understanding of all performance reports and reporting metrics. Be able to present those metrics to customers and or management.Highly efficient utilization of salesforce automation tools of PDA, Computer, field presentation projector, field cameras, etc. Understand all pricing practices, discount procedures and how they impact profitability by product.Whenever deficient, work with the Regional Managers to establish and develop new distributors to provide high quality installation and service for the Military. Be efficient with the computer. Seek to have a skill level of 7 or above (out of 10) in PowerPoint, Excel, Word, Outlook and other existing software utilized by company.Maintain appropriate budget and understand the allocation as it relates to the percent of sales. Access monthly budget expenses via the internet and make adjustments as necessary.Utilize and navigate within internet to communicate, review and gather competitive information, conduct business travel reservations.Forecast Military sales budgets utilizing corporate software.Manage Miliary SalesProvide communication on sales performance and activities to management via a brief summary(s) as requested and in monthly summary(s).Provide timely communication with supervisor on all events in the marketplace that could affect the company.When internal action is required to resolve a challenge, communicate needs to appropriate parties to facility resolution.Provide product/technical knowledge for Rotary and competitive products to the Military.Report early product quality and/or service issues to Rotary via email or monthly reports.Coordinate trade show that fall within the region and implement equipment and set-up work for the show and tear down the equipment.Conduct sales training in the field, or at national meetings and at the schedule training classes held at corporate facilities. Required to have product knowledge of the entire VSG portfolio of products. 

JOB SPECIFICATIONS:

Education: High School Diploma or GEDAbilities: Must have strong speaking and written communication skills, strong leadership skills and be decisive. Must be computer literate.Experience: Minimum five years sales and/or sales management and direct supervisory experience, with the Military. Background managing Military sales, or Government sales. Supervision: Works under own initiative with a minimal amount of guidance.Responsibility: Responsible for the actions and results of Military or Government sales within the region, selection and approval of procurement programs, all sales goals and the achievement of those goals. Exercises high degree of judgment. Works closely with the Director of Sales HD to meet goals for Government Sales. Military Service: Must have served in the Armed Forces with a preference on JSOC or other special operations divisions. A preference will also be given to Warrant Officers. 

Key Dover Competencies:

To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Ethics & Work Standards: Maintain the highest ethical and work standards, while promoting the same attributes in co-workers and others. Insure that all business activities - with both internal and external customers - be performed with a professional demeanor and that all participants be held accountable to this high standard.Communication: Expresses thoughts clearly, both orally and in writing, using good grammar. Presents concise, well organized reports. Listens to understand input, feedback and concerns. Provides complete information in an open, honest, and straight-forward manner. Responds promptly and positively to questions and requests.Teamwork/Relationships: Works with other employees willingly and in a spirit of cooperation and teamwork. Supports cooperation. Demonstrates a commitment to the entire business and is supportive of all initiatives (company and departmental) to help grow Vehicle Service Group's business in the U.S. and abroad. Cooperates fully with others to achieve organizational goals. Is tactful, courteous, and considerate. Embraces a positive outlook. Is respected and trusted by others.Continual Improvement and Problem Resolution: Identifies and communicates suggestions for work improvements. Uses technical/analytical abilities to assure existing work practices are the most efficient and cost effective possible. Performs root-cause analysis and implements viable, permanent solutions to problems. Works with both internal and external customers to develop solutions which meet company-wide needs and objectives. Applies a sense of urgency to resolve problems or create opportunities that will increase productivity and create value. Shares best practices with other employees across the business.Accountability: Accepts responsibility and accountability for both the strategic planning and the successful implementation of all projects/programs/duties as outlined in this job description. Advises supervisor of concerns, problems and progress of work in a timely manner. Demonstrates a sound balance between quality and quantity of work while maintaining a sense of urgency toward completion. Deadlines are met. 

The above description represents a general synopsis of the principal functions of the job, and should not be construed as a comprehensive listing of all requirements that may be inherent in the job.

Equal Opportunity Employer

M/F/D/V

Pay is one of the Total Rewards that we provide to compensate and recognize employees for their work.

title: Portfolio Strategy Associate
description:
At Pathway Homes we create homeowners! Collectively, we believe in doing well by doing good. We are focused on building a collaborative team of like-minded individuals who are aligned with our purpose in driving a meaningful impact on the housing crises facing millions of Americans today. We aim to operate as an all-in-one single-family alternative home buying platform with a fair market product solution assisting buyers to achieve their homeownership dreams. The end-to-end product suite offers a distinctive value proposition in the U.S. $30T+ residential real estate market.

Pathway was formed by ResiLabs , a partnership designed to create new housing solutions that address critical needs in the U.S. residential sector. ResiLabs was established by Regis Group and designed and developed in collaboration with Invitation Homes Inc. (NYSE: INVH ) and Fifth Wall . The senior leadership team combines deep housing expertise with a track record of using technology to provide superior outcomes for customers.

Since launching in November of 2021, Pathway Homes has garnered attention as an innovative platform from Bloomberg and others following an initial $750mm raise to support expanding access to housing for Americans.

This role plays an integral part in providing strategic financial analysis that will help shape new innovative products and execute our fund-raising strategy, including helping raise capital (equity and debt).

In addition to the below responsibilities, a key objective for the successful candidate will be helping to facilitate an investment process with investors and lenders, assisting acquisitions and marketing teams to achieve the company's ambitious targets as we scale up operations.

Responsibilities

Building and maintaining portfolio-level real estate cash flow models, three-statement, and other models as part of new product development.Provide strategic analysis for overall company performance and budgets.Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting for Board level reporting.Assist the acquisition and asset management teams to support on post-closing management.Work alongside the acquisition team regarding potential acquisitions and disposals.Support with processes related to funding, repatriations, and distributions.Ad hoc analysis and other projects when required.

Experience

At least two years' experience in real estate private equity, transaction advisory, mortgage underwriting or real estate investment banking.Exposure to residential real estate would be advantageous.Strong financial modelling experience with exposure to presenting to senior stakeholders is essential.You must have an understanding of corporate finance and capital market concepts.An ability to demonstrate strategic and commercial acumen is crucial for this position.

Culture Identity

Empathetic- for our customers, colleagues, and investors

Agile - willingness and ability to learn on the fly, push outside of your comfort zone

Self-starter - identify opportunities, roll up your sleeves, and get your hands dirty

Ownership – ownership is our job, internally and with our customers

Innovation – focused on growth, advancement of mission to create homeowners

Pathway Perks

Competitive comp

Medical, Dental, Vision & FSA

401K matching

Generous PTO & Holidays

Flexible office space with snacks

We are an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

title: Lead Budget Analyst
company_name: Neighborhood Health Plan of Rhode Island
description:
Job Details

Job Location

Smithfield, RI - Smithfield, RI

Position Type

Full Time

Education Level

Bachelors Degree

Travel Percentage

None

Job Shift

Daytime

Job Category

Professional / Experienced

Description

The Lead Budget Analyst is responsible for the preparation of the company's annual budget and quarterly forecasts. This includes reconciling and recording budget and forecast information accurately and timely into the financial systems including its budgeting software and the general ledger. Interacts and collaborates frequently with Leadership and Senior Leadership to identify upcoming Risks and Opportunities and long-term planning. Assists the Director in the oversight of corporate goals assigned to the department and leads projects that accomplish the goals and objectives of the department. This is an on-site position.

 Duties and Responsibilities   Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:  

 Responsible for the preparation of the annual budget and quarterly multi-year forecasts- Develops templates and/or establish calculations to facilitate collecting department level information from business owners including FTE templates that reconcile to current payroll rosters and review department submissions for completeness and accuracy  Develops templates and/or establish calculations to facilitate collecting product level information from organization for Revenue and Medical expense calculations and review assumptions and submissions for completeness and accuracy  Develops reports to facilitate the budget/forecast consolidation and review process by finance leadership  Responsible for the preparation of project and consulting budgets- Works with Operations and EIG leadership in developing budgets and forecasts for large capital and corporate projects  Works with functional areas to develop budgets and forecasts for yearly inter-departmental project planning  Performs risk management to minimize project risks  Manages changes to the project scope, project schedule, and project costs using appropriate verification techniques as it relates to financial information  Prepare the monthly expense package including analysis for all significant variances of actuals to the budget and forecast for review by manager. Identifies Risks and Opportunities and report them to VP of Finance for ELT reporting  Prepares high level ELT reports for distribution  Provides analysis of financial impact of state budget revisions for senior leadership  Prepares ad-hoc analytics as requested by senior leadership  Provides analytics for increases in costs for external parties and reporting  Assists Director in the oversight of corporate goals assigned to the department  Prepares policies and procedures related to the departments functions  Leads projects that accomplish the goals and objectives of the department. Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget  Provide guidance and direction to other Budget Analysts and their work  Effectively lead, delegate and charge other members of the team to meet expectations  Represent the department in cross-functional projects  Other duties as assigned  Corporate Compliance Responsibility - As an essential function, responsible for complying with Neighborhoods Corporate Compliance Program, Standards of Business Conduct, applicable contracts, laws, rules and regulations, policies and procedures as it applies to individual job duties, the department, and the Company. This position must exercise due diligence to prevent, detect and report unlawful and/or unethical conduct by fellow co-workers, professional affiliates and/or agents 

Qualifications

Qualifications 

Required:

 Bachelor degree in Accounting or Finance or equivalent, relevant work experience to equate to the degree  Minimum of 5 years of budgeting and accounting experience  Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and written, to all levels of management  Strong analytical/problem solving skills and critical thinking  Intermediate to Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook)  Strong computer skills including budgeting and general ledger software  Ability to work under tight timelines and manage multiple tasks simultaneously  Independent work style  Demonstrated ability to produce clear and concise financial analysis  Experience with financial modeling  Experience researching and interpreting federal and state regulatory guidance 


Preferred:

 Experience with Oracle budgeting software  Experience working in Healthcare and/or Insurance industry  Project Management experience  Experience with analytic software (i.e. SQL, SAS, Tableau, Cognos) 


Neighborhood Health Plan of Rhode Island is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Engineering Technician (3475) with Security Clearance
description:
Ghostrock, LLC a subsidiary of Three Saints Bay, LLC, and a federal government contractor is seeking an Engineering Technician to join the team in Norfolk, VA. This position can also be located in San Diego, CA. Position Overview: * Successful candidates will support NSWCPD in the development of Operating Sequencing Systems (OSS) for various operational ship classes. The purpose of OSS is to provide U.S. Navy and U.S. Coast Guard shipboard engineering personnel with technically correct, logically sequenced written procedures, charts, and diagrams tailored to each ship's specific configuration. OSS dictates the procedures to be followed to complete major plant status changes. The use of OSS ensures proper system and equipment operation and minimizes damage to equipment and injury to personnel. * Personnel supporting this effort are anticipated to participate in developing or updating Engineering OSS (EOSS), Aviation Fuel OSS (AFOSS), Sewage Disposal OSS (SDOSS), Catapult OSS (CATOSS), Catapult Lube Oil OSS (CLOSS), Cargo Fuel OSS (CFOSS), Deck OSS (DOSS), and OSS for Hull, Mechanical & Electric (HM&E) systems as required on U.S. Navy and U.S. Coast Guard steam, diesel, and gas turbine powered ships. * Successful candidates will participate in shipboard events during planned maintenance periods where shipboard configurations will be modified. Component, system or complete ship checks will be conducted to validate changes to OSS diagrams/procedures. Position Requirements: * High school, trade, industrial school, or GED equivalent. * Four (4) years of practical engineering experience in the operation, test, maintenance and repair of naval ship Hull, Mechanical, Electrical, Electronic, or Ordnance equipment and systems. * Two (2) years of experience developing/updating technical documentation for U.S. Navy ships systems and equipment. VEVRAA

title: Digital Marketing Specialist
description:
Toledo, OH – Hybrid

 Digital Marketing Specialist  will support content creation, communications/marketing strategy development and implementation, customer relations, and marketing analytics. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in digital marketing, especially social media, SEO, content creation, and content management.

Digital Marketing Specialist Responsibilities

 Content creation, including writing blog posts, articles, newsletters, communications materials, and material for social media channels.  Working cross functionally with our strategic marketing teams, product teams, internal communication teams and outside agencies, as well as customer service and other technical teams.  Create and maintain Content Calendars. Post relevant content in accordance with Content Calendar. Contributes to post campaign insight gathering, reporting, and optimizations. Digital Marketing Specialist Requirements

 BA in communications, advertising, public relations, business or related field. MBA optional  3+ years’ experience managing social media platforms or communities for brands  3+ years working in a corporate or agency environment, interacting with multiple levels of the organization  Prior experience in a wide variety of social media activities such as blogging, community development and management, social bookmarking, commenting, etc.  Past experience in SEO, Copywriting, Content Management, and Content Creation. title: Clinical Trial Manager
description:
Job#: 2018806

Job Description:

Clinical Trial Manager 2018806

Location: Cambridge, MA (Hybrid)

Science: Antibody Drug Conjugates

Therapeutic Area: Oncology

Job Overview: This role is an exciting opportunity for a motivated individual to strategically guide the operationalization of our client’s clinical strategy, mentor colleagues, ensure study performance and efficiency, and make a visible impact in developing assets.

Primary Job Responsibilities:

 Manage and oversee a portion of a larger, international study, ensuring alignment with study goals, SOPs, and regulatory guidelines, with guidance from the CTM.  Coordinate and facilitate the planning, execution, and close-down of clinical studies, including start-up, data analysis, reporting, and adherence to study timelines.  Provide comprehensive review and feedback on clinical study guidance documents, such as protocols, investigator brochures, and various study plans, while ensuring compliance with the client and regulatory guidelines. 

Primary Job Requirements:

 MS/MA/MBA or Bachelors degree, with at least 3 years of clinical research experience, or a Bachelors degree with over 4 years of clinical research experience.  Project Management Professional certification, along with previous experience as a CRA and/or Data Manager, and expertise in process development, management, and GXP remediation.  Demonstrate a proven track record of successfully managing clinical studies, particularly in Phase 1/2 settings in the U.S., with preference given to experience in Phase 3 studies and running studies in ex-US settings.  Proficiency in FDA and ICH GCP regulations are crucial

title: Tax Information Reporting and Withholding (Vice President)
description:
Who We Are

At Galaxy we are building products and services to help the world invest in economic progress. We believe crypto and blockchain innovations will permeate and improve all aspects of our global economy. Our vision is a society where value and ownership flow as freely as information. Galaxy is a digital asset and blockchain leader helping institutions, startups, and individuals access and navigate the crypto economy. As one of the most well-capitalized and trusted companies in the industry, we provide platform solutions custom-made for a digitally native ecosystem across three complementary operating businesses: Global Markets, Asset Management, and Digital Infrastructure Solutions. Our offerings include, amongst others, trading, lending, strategic advisory services, institutional-grade investment solutions across passive, active and venture strategies, proprietary bitcoin mining and hosting services, network validator services, and the development of enterprise custodial technology. Galaxy’s CEO and Founder Michael Novogratz leads a team of crypto enthusiasts, and institutional veterans focused on the future of finance and Web3. The Company is headquartered in New York City, with global across North America, Europe and Asia.

Additional information about the Company's businesses and products is available on www.galaxy.com.

What We Value

We are a diverse team of free thinkers, and fast movers united to help investors and creators energize the global economy. We are looking for individuals who thrive in a culture of builders and overachievers and embrace high performance, transparent feedback, and a mission-first approach. Our culture shapes our way of working and gets us where we want to be.

 Seek Excellence.  Be Selective To Be Effective.  Be Highly Aligned, Loosely Coupled.  Disagree Transparently.  Encourage Independent Decision-Making.  Build Dream Teams. 

Who You Are

The Vice President, Tax Information Reporting and Withholding, will manage all U.S. and non-U.S. tax information reporting and withholding matters across all of Galaxy’s business lines. This person will collaborate with Legal, Finance, Operations, and relevant business units, as well as external advisors, and report to the Head of Tax.

What You’ll Do

Manage U.S. and non-U.S. tax information reporting and withholding matters including, but not limited to, Forms 8804/8805, Forms 1099/1042-S, FATCA, CRS, CbCR, FBAR, Cayman Economic Substance, tax form validation for clients and investors.Develop and implement policies and procedures and work with relevant stakeholders to develop technology to ensure compliance with U.S. and non-U.S. tax information reporting and withholding rules.Advise on tax rules and respond to inquiries from internal stakeholders on matters related to information reporting and withholding.Review, analyze, and interpret current and new reporting and withholding tax guidance (e.g., law, regulations, and rulings) and advise internal stakeholders on impact to current and new products.

What We’re Looking For

Degree in Accounting, Finance, or LawAt least 7 years of substantial experience in tax information reporting and withholding, ideally within a global bank/financial institution or a combinationTechnical knowledge of tax laws and regulations related to tax information reporting and withholding, with a focus on financial products and servicesCost basis reporting and expertise in Form 1099-B reporting, as well as experience with building out internal systems and technology for proper reportingAbility to work independently, but within a team-oriented, collaborative environmentExcellent communication and critical thinking skills

Bonus Points

Experience with digital asset reportingFamiliarity with new digital asset broker reporting regulationsExperience with automating tax processesExperience working with “Up-C” structures and partnerships

What We Offer

Competitive base salary and discretionary bonusFlexible Time Off (i.e. unlimited paid vacation days)Company paid Holidays (11)Company paid sick leaveCompany-paid health and protective benefits for employees, partners, and other dependents3% 401(k) company contributionGenerous paid Parental LeaveFree virtual coaching and counseling sessions through GingerOpportunities to learn about the Crypto industryFree daily snacks in-officeSmart, entrepreneurial, and fun colleaguesEmployee Resource Groups

Apply now and join us on our mission to engineer a new economic paradigm.

The base salary ranges included below will be commensurate with candidate experience, expertise and local market. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors, including candidate experience and expertise. At Galaxy, we maintain a total compensation philosophy which consists of a competitive base salary, annual bonus, and equity incentives.

Base Salary Range

$170,000 — $200,000 USD

Galaxy respects diversity and seeks to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and job applicants for employment without regard to actual or perceived age, race, color, creed, religion, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital or partnership or caregiver status, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, disability, military or veteran status, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information or predisposing genetic characteristic, or other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws and ordinances.

We will endeavor to make a reasonable accommodation to the known limitations of a qualified applicant with a disability unless the accommodation would impose an undue hardship on the operation of our business. If you believe you require such assistance to complete the application process or to participate in an interview, please contact careers@galaxy.com.

We are seeking a highly skilled Supply Chain Architect with expertise in the banking domain and proficiency in Ariba to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of supply chain processes within the banking sector and extensive experience in implementing Ariba solutions to optimize procurement and sourcing operations.

Responsibilities:

Design and Architectural Planning: Develop comprehensive supply chain architecture strategies aligned with the organization's business goals and objectives. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand requirements and design solutions that leverage Ariba's capabilities effectively.Ariba Implementation and Integration: Lead the implementation of Ariba solutions within the banking environment, ensuring seamless integration with existing systems and processes. Develop and implement strategies to streamline procurement, sourcing, and vendor management workflows, leveraging Ariba functionalities to achieve operational excellence.Vendor Management: Oversee vendor relationships and ensure compliance with contractual agreements and service level agreements (SLAs). title: Project Manager (Physical Security, Alarm Systems, Access Control) - 23930
description:
Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Computer Enterprises, Inc., is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!

CEI s innovative municipal Client is looking to add a Physical Security Project Manager to their team!

Job at a glance:

This is a long-term contract of 12+ months that could extend beyond with possibility of conversion to FTE$45-$50/hr W2 + optional benefits (Medical, Dental, Vision, and 401k)Hybrid position, onsite 3 days/wk in Aurora, CO remote 2 days per weekSeeking Project Managers experienced with Security System Design and Implementation and our Client rolls out their project to upgrade video cameras and related equipment 

What does the Role Entail:

As a Physical Security Project Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the planning, implementation, and execution of physical security projects. You will collaborate with various stakeholders to ensure that our physical security measures align with organizational goals and industry standards. This role requires strong project management skills, technical expertise in security systems, and the ability to coordinate complex projects from conception to completion.

Responsibilities:

Project Planning and Coordination:

Develop and maintain comprehensive project plans outlining scope, objectives/deliverables, durations, and resource requirements.Coordinate with internal teams, external vendors, and project stakeholders to ensure alignment with project goals and deliverables.Establish clear communication methods and channels to provide regular updates on project progress, status, and address report any issues or risks concerns to Project Stakeholders and City Management.Oversee and coordinate the installation, configuration, and testing of security systems, including access control, surveillance cameras, intrusion detection, and alarm systems.

Budgeting and Resource Management:

Forecast Project Budgetary and Resource Needs.Develop project budgets and corresponding burn reports as well as tracking expenses and resource utilization throughout the project lifecycle relative to IT costs.Collaborate Work with internal teams within on the Procurement Process for necessary equipment, materials, and services within budgetary constraints.Optimize resource allocation to maximize efficiency and minimize project costs.

Risk Management and Mitigation:

Identify potential risks and vulnerabilities in physical security systems and develop mitigation strategies.Schedule and document regular security assessments and audits to evaluate system effectiveness and address any vulnerabilities or gaps.Work with the Security and IT Teams to implement contingency plans to mitigate disruptions or security incidents.

Documentation Support:

Provide documentation support from projects to end-users and stakeholders on security system operation, maintenance, and emergency procedures.Maintain accurate documentation, including project plans, technical specifications, user manuals, and incident reports for future reference.

Experience:

Proven experience in project management, preferably in the field of physical security, engineering, or related industries.Knowledge of security systems and technologies, including access control, video surveillance, intrusion detection, and alarm systems.Familiarity with relevant regulations, standards, and best practices in physical security (e.g., ASIS International, ISC2).Strong communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.

Education:

Bachelor's degree in computer or management science or a related field from an accredited college/university.

Knowledge:

Must have thorough knowledge and understanding of project management fundamentals, process design, project estimation, budgeting, and ability to do project risk assessment and mitigation.Must be conversant with current project management methodologies, as well as the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) for waterfall, Agile and hybrid approaches.Must have a working knowledge of IT infrastructure, systems integration, vendor, and purchase management.Security System Design and Implementation understanding (PREFERRED)A combination of relevant education and experience may be substituted for the minimum education and experience requirements on a year for year basis

Licenses Required:

Valid Colorado Driver's License.

Company Culture:

The IT mission is to review, recommend, plan, and implement technology solutions that enhance the way the city conducts its business practices. Our vision is to provide leading-edge technology that affects innovative improvement in business processes, thereby positioning the City as a leader in the use of technology in local government.

As a trusted technology partner, CEI delivers solutions that help our customers transform their businesses and achieve meaningful results. From strategy and custom application development through application management - our technology and digital experience services are tailored to meet each unique need of our customers. Our staffing solutions bring specialized skills to complement our customers' workforce and project requirements.

You will focus on driving analytical capabilities for the logistics organization that affect distribution, transportation, and inventory. In partnership with leadership, evaluate and implement the latest analytics tools and technologies, prioritizing cloud-based solutions that offer scalability, reliability, and real-time data processing capabilities.

Act as core liaison between the Global Logistics function and other business units, ensuring alignment on analytical strategic initiatives.

Drive the innovation and integration of cloud technology solutions within the logistics and supply chain functions, ensuring they are leveraged to their full potential for analytics and decision-making.

Communication and analytical skills, sql, python, data visualization, cloud, azure, power bi, microstrategy, sap erp, wms

Communication and analytical skills, sql, python, data visualization, cloud

Excellent project management skills (including prioritization and organization) with ability to influence key business stakeholders to drive positive outcomes

title: Director – Price Value Innovation
description:
Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver. Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.
Position Summary:CVS Health is seeking a passionate customer visionary to join our team to build and implement holistic value strategies inclusive of price, promo and loyalty to improve customer price perception and deepen engagement with current and new customers.
In this role you will be an integral member of the Price Value Team. This team is responsible for Price, Promotion and Coupon strategies for CVS Front store. The contributions you will make as a Lead Director will drive the future of CVS Health’s value strategy.
As the Director of Price & Value Innovation, you will develop holistic, customer-centric price and value strategies & plans that inspire customers to consistently choose CVS as their health and wellness retailer of choice. Our goal is to accelerate growth in sales units and customer trips.In this role, you will operate in an ambiguous, innovative environment. Ability to learn quickly, think critically in white space will be critical to success. The Director will lead a team to drive a deep understanding of the CVS customer and their needs. You will play an integral role in influencing across the CVS retail org to increase customer-centric thinking. Your ability to clearly tell a compelling business story to drive understanding and alignment across teams will be critical to your success. 
You will accomplish this by:Lead & perform deep customer & market analyses to develop category specific business insights & recommendations to accelerate growth in sales units and customer trips.Build category level holistic, customer-centric price and value strategies.Lead a team 2-4 direct reports to perform customer analysis to identify customer segments, attributes and behavior patterns to find opportunity to improve regular prices and promo/coupon plans.Building trusted relationships and collaborative partnerships with multiple teams & leaders across the Front Store organization including Merchandising, Marketing & Stores Loyalty & Personalization, Retail Analytics and Retail Marketing teams.Creating & compelling story telling across teams & levels.
Required Qualifications:10+ years of relevant experience in either Management Consulting or Retail/CPGMerchandising familiarity – understanding of retail merchandising basics (i.e., Category Management), and merchandising organizational structures and processesMastery of Microsoft Excel and PowerPointExperience leading, developing, and managing a teamAnalytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to concisely present to senior leaders and build trustWillingness and ability to travel up to (25%)Ability to operate in an ambiguous, innovative environmentAbility to learn quickly and think critically in white spaceAbility to create & tell a compelling story telling across teams & levels
Preferred Qualifications:Consulting experienceMBATeam Leadership experiencePrevious Management Consulting experience for a top tier firmSpecific experience in Retail category management, CPG, or vendor management leading strategic commercial projects with significant business impactRetail/CPG experience and/or experience analyzing large customer / transaction data sets
Education:Bachelor's Degree or equivalent work experience
Pay Range:The typical pay range for this role is:
$100,000.00 – $231,500.00This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above. This position also includes an award target in the company’s equity award program.  In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.  For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit jobs.CVSHealth.com/benefits
